revised_title: Electrolysis of Dilute Sulphuric Acid and Other Hydrated Salts
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the electrolysis of dilute sulphuric acid and other hydrated salts. They found that the method used was unable to determine whether it was the acid or the hydrate that was decomposed during electrolysis. The authors also discovered that the "unequal transference of ions" played a significant role in the chemical changes during electrolysis.
